reviews.content: Just changed doctors over to the Noorani medical group and I'm glad I did. Very new clean office, professional staff and great drs. After a very short wait in the waiting room went through my vitals and minutes later seen by the Dr. Tabrez Noorani. He was Professional and accurately diagnosed me after listening to a list of ailments. With so many drs to choose from in the area, this is has been one of the best experiences I have had.

Nice office but idk who was hammering away outside my door but holy moly so obnoxious! And then after waiting for an hour I was ushered out of the door and I felt none of my questions were answered just kind of confused and frustrated at this point. The staff was nice but disconnected. After I do this blood work that I need that has been rescheduled for tomorrow, I don't plan to come back.

Dr. Noorani is the nicest and most attentive doctor I've ever had. She answers all of my questions thoroughly and competently. The staff is very pleasant and easy to work with. I can't recommend her enough!

I don't expect much from doctors in Florida but if I call with leg pain/swelling and possible blood clot... I wouldn't expect an office make me wait 2 days for an appointment like this office did. . This is the 3rd time this has happened, and I wait on average 2 hours to see a doctor (or PA) so I know others get worked in on emergency basis so... I switched doctors with this last episode.. After the doctor herself agreed that the 2 day wait was acceptable. . I'm a nurse, and that was not acceptable to me.
